page.title: 06DAIRY FARMING
page.content: With dairy farming you have to milk the cows in the morning and at night. You put the cows in the ring; the ring is somewhere you keep the cows before you milk them. We milk the cows in the milking parlour. To milk the cows we put a milk cluster on the teats of the cow's udder. When the cows are being milked,they have VICON. Cows can get a disease called mastitis, they get this when the bag is damaged. In the summer they spend the night in the fields, and in the winter they go in the cow sheds. In the summer they eat hay; in the winter they are fed on silage. We have about sixty-three cows. They take up 30 acres of pasture land. They give about 250 gallons of milk each day.
